description: Magyars are a cavalry-focused civilization that excels in hit-and-run tactics and raiding.
dark_age: Build 1 house and a lumber camp near forests.
Train additional villagers from the town center.
Use the scout to explore the map and find resources.
Advance to Feudal Age at around 22-23 minutes with 500 food and 200 gold.
Have around 800-1000 food, 150-200 wood, and 150-200 gold at the end of the Dark Age.
Assign 4-5 villagers to food, 2-3 to wood, 1-2 to gold, and 3-4 to stone.
feudal_age: Build additional stables and continue producing cavalry units.
Build a blacksmith and market to upgrade cavalry and sell excess resources for gold.
Advance to Castle Age at around 28-29 minutes with 800 food and 400 gold.
Have around 1500-2000 food, 600-800 wood, 500-600 gold, and 400-500 stone at the end of the Feudal Age.
Assign 8-10 villagers to food, 5-6 to wood, 3-4 to gold, and 6-7 to stone.
castle_age: Build a monastery and start training monks.
Research the unique technology, Corvinian Army, for additional attack and hit points for cavalry units.
Build a second town center and start training villagers.
Advance to Imperial Age at around 35-36 minutes with 1000 food, 1000 gold, and 800 stone.
Have around 3000-3500 food, 2000-2500 wood, 1200-1500 gold, and 1200-1500 stone at the end of the Castle Age.
Assign 20-25 villagers to food, 10-12 to wood, 8-10 to gold, and 12-15 to stone.
imperial_age: Train elite Magyar huszars, which have high attack and speed.
Use hit-and-run tactics to raid enemy economy and disrupt their army.
Research the unique technology, Recurve Bow, for improved cavalry archer performance.
Have around 5000-6000 food, 3000-4000 wood, and 2000-2500 gold at the end of the Imperial Age.
Assign 40-50 villagers to food, 20-25 to wood, 16-20 to gold, and 25-30 to stone.
